title: How to Make a Pop Tab Wristband

steps.title: Configure the alignment of the tabs.
steps.content: Configure the alignment of the tabs. If you alternate placing the tops back to front so that the backs of the top layer and the backs of the bottom layer are facing, it will reduce irritation on your skin.

steps.title: Cut two pieces of long cord, string or ribbon.
steps.content: Cut two pieces of long cord, string or ribbon. They must be at least 24 inches (61cm) long to provide enough length for you to tie knots at the ends.

steps.title: Tie the two cords together
steps.content: Tie the two cords together with approximately 2 inch (5cm) tails.

steps.title: Thread one cord up through the top hole in a tab.
steps.content: Thread one cord up through the top hole in a tab. Take the second cord and thread it up through the bottom hole.

steps.title: Lay a second tab half on top of the first tab so that the coinciding holes overlap.
steps.content: Lay a second tab half on top of the first tab so that the coinciding holes overlap.

steps.title: Thread the top cord over the left edge of the second tab and down through the first tab's top hole.
steps.content: Thread the top cord over the left edge of the second tab and down through the first tab's top hole.

steps.title: Do the same with the bottom string, through the bottom hole.
steps.content: Do the same with the bottom string, through the bottom hole. Pull the cords tightly through the tabs––this gives it the layered look.

steps.title: Turn the tabs over.
steps.content: Turn the tabs over. Overlap a third tab on the second one (touching the first tab)

steps.title: Thread the top cord over the first and third tabs, through the third tab's top hole and down through the second tab's top hole.
steps.content: Thread the top cord over the first and third tabs, through the third tab's top hole and down through the second tab's top hole.

steps.title: Do the same with the bottom string, through the bottom holes.
steps.content: Do the same with the bottom string, through the bottom holes.

steps.title: Continue with this pattern until the bracelet is as long as you need it, alternating back and forth between threading the cords from the back and front.
steps.content: Continue with this pattern until the bracelet is as long as you need it, alternating back and forth between threading the cords from the back and front.

steps.title: End with a top tab (one that lies on the top layer) by threading each cord up through the corresponding hole.
steps.content: End with a top tab (one that lies on the top layer) by threading each cord up through the corresponding hole.

steps.title: Tie a knot to secure.
steps.content: Tie a knot to secure. Cut the ends to approximately two inches (5cm).

steps.title: Tie the ends together in a double knot.
steps.content: Tie the ends together in a double knot.
